reasoning.prompt: If Monday comes before Tuesday, and Tuesday comes before Wednesday, what day comes between Monday and Wednesday?
All roses are flowers. Some flowers fade quickly. Therefore, can we conclude that all roses fade quickly? Answer Yes or No.
If Alice is taller than Bob, and Bob is taller than Charlie, who is the shortest?
A farmer has 17 sheep. All but 9 die. How many sheep are left?
If you overtake the person in 2nd place in a race, what position are you in now?
A bat and ball cost $1.10 together. The bat costs $1 more than the ball. How much does the ball cost in cents?
Three switches control three light bulbs in another room. You can flip switches but can only check the room once. Can you determine which switch controls which bulb? Answer Yes or No.
If it takes 5 machines 5 minutes to make 5 widgets, how many minutes would it take 100 machines to make 100 widgets?
Two fathers and two sons go fishing. They each catch one fish. Only 3 fish are caught total. How is this possible? The answer involves a generational relationship.
A bookshelf has 5 shelves. Each shelf can hold 7 books. If 28 books are already on the shelves, how many more books can fit?
If you have 3 apples and you give away 2, how many apples do you have?
Mary's father has 5 daughters: Nana, Nene, Nini, Nono. What is the fifth daughter's name?
If a red house is made of red bricks, and a blue house is made of blue bricks, what is a greenhouse made of?
Forward I am heavy, backward I am not. What am I? (3-letter word)
A clock shows 3:15. What is the angle between the hour and minute hands? Answer in degrees.
If all Bloops are Razzies and all Razzies are Lazzies, are all Bloops definitely Lazzies? Answer Yes or No.
In a group of 23 people, what is the probability that at least two share a birthday? Is it more or less than 50%? Respond with 'more' or 'less'.
A rope ladder that floats hangs over the side of a ship. The rungs are 1 foot apart. At low tide, 10 rungs are above water. The tide rises 5 feet. How many rungs are above water?
You're in a room with two doors. One leads to freedom, one to death. Two guards: one always lies, one always tells truth. You can ask one guard one question. What do you ask?
If 5 cats catch 5 mice in 5 minutes, how many cats are needed to catch 100 mice in 100 minutes?

A farmer wants to cross a river with a fox, chicken, and bag of grain. The boat holds only him and one item. Fox eats chicken, chicken eats grain if left alone. Can he get all across? Answer Yes or No.

Here is a question 'In a race, you passed the person in last place. What position are you in now?' Is the situation described by the question possible or impossible? Answer 'possible' or 'impossible'.
A snail is at the bottom of a 30-foot well. Each day it climbs up 3 feet but slides back 2 feet at night. How many days to reach the top?
Two trains are 100 miles apart, heading toward each other at 50 mph each. A bird flies at 75 mph between them until they meet. How far does the bird fly?
If you multiply all the numbers on a telephone dial pad (1-9 and 0), what is the result?
The field filled with grass is wet but it didn't rain last night and no sprinklers were on. What is the most likely explanation?
All the lights in the office are on but nobody is there. It's 10 PM on a Sunday. What's the likely reason?
A car has its hazard lights blinking on the side of the highway. What can you infer about the situation?
The coffee shop has a long line at 8 AM on Monday but is nearly empty at 2 PM. Why?
A person carries an umbrella on a sunny day. What might they know that you don't?
The bread is moldy but was bought only 2 days ago. What condition likely caused this?
A restaurant has pictures of food instead of written descriptions on the menu. What kind of clientele might they serve?
Your phone battery drains much faster than usual today. You haven't changed any settings or downloaded any new apps. What's a likely cause?
A dog barks at the door at the same time every evening. What has it learned?
The grocery store is out of milk, eggs, and bread. What event likely happened or is expected?
A child remembers the alphabet song and can sing it but can't identify individual letters. What skill are they missing?
Someone's desk has a standing desk converter, ergonomic keyboard, and wrist rest. What problem are they addressing?
A movie theater is packed on a rainy Saturday afternoon. Why?
Your neighbor's house lights turn on and off at different times each evening while they're on vacation. What system are they using?
A website loads slowly only during business hours. What is the bottleneck?
Birds are flying south in October in the Northern Hemisphere. What are they doing?
A laptop has stickers from multiple countries and airlines. What does this suggest about the owner?
The park has extra trash bins installed before the weekend. What are authorities anticipating?
A plant's leaves are turning yellow despite regular watering. What's likely wrong?
A person has paint under their fingernails and smells like turpentine. What is their likely profession or hobby?
The library is unusually crowded during finals week. What are students doing?
A child asks 'why' after every statement you make. What developmental stage are they in?
The gym parking lot is full at 6 AM but half-empty at noon. What explains this pattern?
A book's pages are yellowed and brittle despite being kept indoors. What factor caused this?
Someone checks their watch repeatedly while sitting in a cafe. What are they likely doing?
Which planet is known as the Red Planet? A) Venus B) Mars C) Jupiter D) Saturn
What is the capital of France? A) London B) Berlin C) Paris D) Madrid
Which element has the chemical symbol 'O'? A) Gold B) Oxygen C) Silver D) Iron
How many sides does a hexagon have? A) 5 B) 6 C) 7 D) 8
Who wrote 'Romeo and Juliet'? A) Charles Dickens B) Jane Austen C) William Shakespeare D) Mark Twain
Which ocean is the largest? A) Atlantic B) Indian C) Arctic D) Pacific
What is the square root of 144? A) 10 B) 11 C) 12 D) 13
Which programming language is known for its use in web development and has a snake as its logo? A) Java B) Python C) Ruby D) PHP
How many continents are there? A) 5 B) 6 C) 7 D) 8
What is the freezing point of water in Celsius? A) -10 B) 0 C) 10 D) 32
Which of these is NOT a primary color? A) Red B) Yellow C) Green D) Blue
What is the largest mammal on Earth? A) African Elephant B) Blue Whale C) Giraffe D) Polar Bear
In what year did World War II end? A) 1943 B) 1944 C) 1945 D) 1946
Which data structure uses LIFO (Last In First Out)? A) Queue B) Stack C) Array D) Tree
What is the powerhouse of the cell? A) Nucleus B) Ribosome C) Mitochondria D) Chloroplast
Which country has the most time zones? A) Russia B) USA C) China D) France
What is the result of 2^10? A) 512 B) 1024 C) 2048 D) 4096
Which HTTP status code indicates 'Not Found'? A) 200 B) 301 C) 404 D) 500
What does CPU stand for? A) Central Processing Unit B) Computer Personal Unit C) Central Program Utility D) Core Processing Utility
Which sort algorithm has average time complexity of O(n log n) and is often used in practice? A) Bubble Sort B) Merge Sort C) Selection Sort D) Insertion Sort
What is the smallest prime number? A) 0 B) 1 C) 2 D) 3
Which layer of the OSI model is responsible for routing? A) Transport B) Network C) Data Link D) Application
What is the binary representation of decimal 10? A) 1001 B) 1010 C) 1100 D) 1111
Which design pattern ensures a class has only one instance? A) Factory B) Singleton C) Observer D) Strategy
Unscramble these letters to form a programming concept: ADAT
What 5-letter word becomes shorter when you add two letters to it?
Unscramble: TPNYOH (a programming language)
I am a 7-letter word. Remove my first letter and I become a crime. Remove my first two letters and I become an animal. What word am I?
Unscramble: OELHL (a common greeting)
What word starts with 'e', ends with 'e', and contains one letter?
Unscramble: HTUA (authentication shortened)
What 4-letter word can be written forward, backward, or upside down and still be read the same?
Unscramble: EVRERS (where you host applications)
I have cities but no houses, forests but no trees, water but no fish. What am I?
Unscramble: UEQYR (database operation)
What word contains all five vowels in alphabetical order?
Unscramble: ARARY (data structure)
What 4-letter palindrome means to observe or notice?
Unscramble: ETKNO (authentication credential)
Remove one letter from 'STARTLED' to make a word meaning 'tasted'. What letter?
Unscramble: HCECA (temporary storage)
What 5-letter word has 6 left when you take 2 away?
Unscramble: DBUGE (finding errors in code)
I'm a word of letters three. Add two and fewer there will be. What word am I?
Unscramble: CNSYA (non-blocking programming)
What common English word has the letters 'kst' together?
Unscramble: SONJ (data format)
What 4-letter word can you remove 1 letter from and have any left?
Unscramble: LUDCO (computing infrastructure)
I can be cracked, made, told, and played. What am I?
Unscramble: EMRGE (combining branches)
What 5-letter word typed in all capital letters reads the same upside down?
Unscramble: TCHEF (retrieve data)
The more you take, the more you leave behind. What am I?
